resources.string: Automatically download attachments for incoming emails
Only download attachments when manually requested

Chess is a traditional boardgame that is thousands of years old. It is played on an 8x8 grid of alternating black and white tiles, which act as the board, and 32 pieces, 16 black and 16 white. Player 1 has control over the white pieces, and Player 2 has control over the black pieces.

To the right are the pieces, ranked from top to bottom by their worth. For each color, there are 8 pawns, 2 knights, 2 bishops, 2 rooks, and one queen and king. Each piece is allowed to move according to specific rules, and they can take pieces of the other color, which are then discarded from the board. The goal is to take your opponent\'s King, or put the King in a position where there is no way for the opponent to avoid losing the King.

We invite you to try playing to learn more about each piece\'s moveset, as this game will not allow illegal movement. The game continues passing from one player\'s move to another until the King is put in that position of no movement (called checkmate). Each time a piece places itself in a way such that in the next turn, that piece can take the opposing player\'s King, the King is said to be \"in check\". You will see the King highlighted orange, and the player must move in such a way to stop that attack. At checkmate, the King will turn highlighted red, and the game will be over.
